A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Jenkins makes the bold move of restarting the series... in the 8th of 9 movies.  He mercilessly trolled the audience that invested time and thought into the plot of The Force Awakens and he didn't understand the characters.  I think the critical praise it's receiving is because the movie is objectively good.  It does all the things critics wanted to see\, so they were backed into a corner of giving it a great score.  The problem is RJ relied way too heavily on the gimmick of \"subverting expectations\" instead of trying to tell a good cogent story that understoof its characters\, its source materials and the concept of a story arc.  It's messy\, it goes on way too long and the humor is shoe horned in so badly\, a canned laughter track would have actually helped.  I wanted to like this movie so bad\, but its just a sloppy mess.
